author: julieannebird
title: Wonderful service, gem of a hotel
text:
This hotel seemed to share amenities, hallways, and lobbies with the adjoining World Center Hotel. When we checked in, Kevin Chang welcomed us with terrific customer service and fun quick-witted banter. He was so helpful. We stayed in room 1008, which was a CORNER room with a little living room, a bedroom, and a very nice bathroom. These rooms are small (Euro sized) but have Keurig coffee makers, flat screen TV's, super comfy beds, and ours had a (you won't believe this) BIG balcony with a table and chairs. The view was sobering, as it looked directly over ground zero, the 9/11 Memorial and Museum, but magnificent. I feel fortunate to have stayed in that room. We go to NYC once or twice a year, and we would return to this hotel on a future visit.
